Class SimGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • SimGrid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class SimGrid
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    Part of the solution to Project 4. Represents the grid of agents in the Schelling Simulation.
    Version:
    2018.04.11
    Author:
    lewis63 and mchris99

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimGrid(int rows, int cols)
      Creates and initializes an agent grid of the specified size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getSatisfiedPercent()
      Gets the current percentage of satisfied agents in the grid.
      void initializeGrid()
      Fills the grid with an initial, random set of agents and vacant spaces.
      int performSimulationStep()
      Performs one step of the simulation by finding the location of all unsatisfied agents, then moving each one to a randomly chosen vacant location.
      void resetGrid()
      Resets the simulation grid by clearing the pane of agent squares and reinitializing the grid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimGrid

        public SimGrid(int rows,
               int cols)
        Creates and initializes an agent grid of the specified size.
        Parameters:
        rows - the number of rows in the simulation grid
        cols - the number of cols in the simulation grid

    • Method Detail

      • getSatisfiedPercent

        public double getSatisfiedPercent()
        Gets the current percentage of satisfied agents in the grid.
        Returns:
        the percentage of satisfied agents in the simulation

      • initializeGrid

        public void initializeGrid()
        Fills the grid with an initial, random set of agents and vacant spaces. Approximately 10% of the grid locations are left vacant. The rest are evenly distributed between red and blue agents.

      • performSimulationStep

        public int performSimulationStep()
        Performs one step of the simulation by finding the location of all unsatisfied agents, then moving each one to a randomly chosen vacant location.
        Returns:
        the number of unsatisfied agents found

      • resetGrid

        public void resetGrid()
        Resets the simulation grid by clearing the pane of agent squares and reinitializing the grid.
